oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bullet mold
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Civil War era bullet mold. Bullet molds were carried by some Civil War soldiers to melt spent lead rounds to make their own ammunition. Bullet molds were used to shape Minie balls. They also provided the conical base and rings around the center of the ordnance which permitted bullets to better fit into the guns. Molds were typically heated over fires and cooled in water.
